comment.author: 7517447@N07
comment._content: According to David Miller in "Charles Kerry's Federation Australia" ISBN 0908197330. These photographs, taken from a high viewpoint, were made by Willen van der Valden firstly for a commission Kerry had to document the streets of Sydney for the Australian Town and Country Journal. He used a wide angle lens and perched on top of a mobile tower. Ref P.20

comment.author: 31939802@N04
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Life's Art, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 35951588@N07
comment._content: Apparently James Barnet was less than impressed with Vernon's additions to his original design. The Queen Anne revival style mansard roofs and vertical additions had definitely ruined the clean finish the original parapet had.
